titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the E. Vincent Cowdry papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA155
titlestmt.author: Gladys Lewis

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-10 16:12:53 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: E. Vincent Cowdry papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

did.unittitle: Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Selected items of correspondence are described in this series.

did.unittitle: E.V. Cowdry/S. Flexner, re arrival at PUMC (Peking Union Medical College), Peking w/ Encl: "Contributions from the Department of Anatomy, Peking Union Medical College of the Rockefeller Foundation"
Volume 1
Volume 2 (with the publisher)
Program of monthly meetings of the "Anatomical and Anthropological Association of China" held at PUMC

Exchange between S. Flexner, E.V. Cowdry, Miss von der Osten. and E. Bakaner re offer of appointment at RIMR for 2 years beginning July 1, 1921 and E.V. Cowdry's acceptance by cable Jan 31, 1921 and then by letter dated Feb 1, 1921
S. Flexner/E.B. Smith w/Encl: Draft of Feb 4, 1921 letter to Cowdry outlining conditions of RIMR appointment
S. Flexner/E.V. Cowdry. Carbon copy of final letter outlining conditions of RIMR appointment including added specific conditions
E.V. Cowdry/S. Flexner, accepts appointment as of July 1, 1921
Cowdry/E.B. Smith, re Willie Masek
Exchange between E.V. Cowdry and S. Flexner re invitation by Sir Arnold Theiler to E.V. Cowdry to spend one year at Transvaal University College, Pretoria
C.C. Williamson/S. Flexner w/attached clipping: 1923 Dec 29, The African World, "Sir Arnold Theiler's American Tour." [Letter written by Sir Arnold Theiler aboard "President Cleveland, " 26 Nov 1923]
Cowdry/E.B. Smith re William Masek
Estimate [of expenditures] covering period to June 30, 1924, Dr. Cowdry's expedition to South Africa
JAMA [Journal of the American Medical Association] clipping, re Cowdry to South Africa, Transvaal University College, Pretoria, to study life cycle of protozoa causing diseases in domestic animals
E.B. Smith/Cowdry, re deferred annuity, apartment, Dr. Nicholson and Willie Masek
Cowdry/S. Flexner re Dr. du Toit
S. Flexner/Cowdry re Cowdry book "Cytology, " Rickettsia findings and report and Dr. du Toit

Exchange between Cowdry, S. Flexner and 1 item with Theobald Smith/S. Flexner re Cowdry's work on 'Rickettsia' includes 2 photographs of Rickettsia cells [in cases of Heartwater] and re Hans Theiler (Sir Arnold's son)
Sir Arnold Theiler/S. Flexner, re Cowdry's success in study of Heartwater and Rickettsia and praise of Cowdry
S. Flexner/Sir Arnold Theiler, acknowledgment of Nov 5 letter and re Theobald Smith's willingness to appoint Sir Arnold Theiler's son, a Fellow, at RIMR Princeton

Exchange between E.V. Cowdry and Simon Flexner. re publication of following in JEM and Theiler's report in South Africa re discovery of Rickettsia, with approval of publication by S. Flexner and continuation of investigations by Cowdry in New York
Part 1: Heartwater dealing with the Rickettsia in infected mammals
Part 2: Heartwater dealing with the Rickettsia in ticks
Part 3: Deals with certain microorganisms transmitted hereditarily in ticks and not associated with disease
Cowdry/E.B. Smith re return from South Africa, early March 1925
Cowdry/F. Stanley Howe, re William Masek
Howe/E.B. Smith re form letter, 12 June 1925, re Peking Union Medical College "Yu Wang Fu Association"
Cowdry/E.B. Smith re Dr. John Smith
Cowdry/E.B. Smith re recommendation of Dr. Theodore Dunham by E.F. Du Bois, 20 June 1925 to Cowdry w/ E.B. Smith reply, 7 July 1925
Cowdry/E.B. Smith re Miss Tilden's work
Cowdry/Dr. Blake, accepting appointment as Associate Member, RIMR
Exchange between Cowdry and E.B. Smith re "Thelco" incubator for Dr. Hughes' work at Woods Hole
Exchange between Dr. Cowdry, S. Flexner, Thoebald Smith and Business Manager re Cowdry's trip to Tunis to study the organism Anaplasmosis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: Correspondence re request for travel expenses to Tunis and Cowdry's, "Estimate of Travel Expense of E.V. Cowdry to Tunis and Return" and statement re purpose of trip, "Objects of Proposed Expedition to Tunis" and approval of appropriations for equipment and travel by RIMR Bd of Sci Dirs.

did.unittitle: Exchange between Simon Flexner, Colonial Secretary of Nairobi and J. Butler Wright, Assistant Secretary of State re invitation to Cowdry to study a parasitic development in ticks. Regrets, since Cowdry engaged in study of Anaplasmosis at the Pasteur Institute, in Tunis
Exchange between Dr. Cowdry, E.B. Smith, and Commissioner of Immigration re letter certifying Dr. Cowdry's son born in U.S.A. for reentry into country
E.B. Smith/Cowdry re lab budget for 1927-1928
Cowdry/E.B. Smith, thank you for letter to Commissioner of Immigration and request for additional lab space

Exchange between Cowdry, E.B. Smith and Barney Lupinek re granting additional lab space to Cowdry, requests for adjustments with Enclosure: Sketch of lab, and correspondence re work on rooms for Cowdry's new suite
List of expenditures for equiping Rooms 309-310, C.B. [Central Building] for Dr. Cowdry

Exchange between Dr. Cowdry, E.B. Smith, Professor Nicolle, E.C.C., H.O. re cost of engravings for Cowdry's two Heartwater Papers in Archiv de l'Institut Pasteur de Tunis and JEM, August 1925, Vol 42, No. 2 and in the Studies
Exchange re supplementary funds for Cowdry's budget 1927-28 w/S. Flexner approval of
[S. Flexner?] /Cowdry. Evaluation of Dr. Cowdry personally and professionally on leaving RIMR
[S. Flexner?] /Cowdry. Congratulations on new appointment and re Cavell and Scott
E.V. Cowdry/Francis G. Blake. Letter of resignation as Associate Member, RIMR, as of Aug 31, 1928 to Professor of Cytology, Washington University Medical School, St. Louis, Mo
Exchange between Cowdry/E.B. Smith re S. Flexner approval of Cowdry taking table incubator box to Saint Louis
[Copy]. Cowdry/S. Flexner re Noguchi memorial service at University of Chicago?
Exchange between Cowdry/E.B. Smith re Cowdry becoming a naturalized citizen of U.S.A.

Herald Tribune, "Sees Lung Cancer Mortality Rising". Newspaper clipping re Cowdry's statement at opening (Sept 8) of 14th Annual Conference of the Institutum Divi Thomae, a Roman Catholic Medical Research organization in Cincinnati
Reports

"Communications from Dr. E.V. Cowdry and Sir Arnold Theiler Relating to Dr. Cowdry's Work at the Transvaal University College in Pretoria". 3 duplicated copies containing Dr. Cowdry/ S. Flexner communications of 1924 Nov 11, 17 and S.A. Theiler/Flexner, 1924 Nov 5 re scientific work by Cowdry in South Africa

"Report by Dr. E.V. Cowdry Work Done Under Special Appropriation for Study un the Auspices of the Dept of Agriculture of the Union of South Africa in the Acceptance of an Invitation by Sir Arnold Theiler"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 duplicated copies of report pp 95-99 and 6 pp of illustrations (pp 100-105) dealing with these studies. Also includes a working copy with corrections of report.
